Name: String of beads with funerary scarab
Description: String of faience beads made from the tubular and disk beads of a mummy-net, with as a pendant a large funerary scarab in the same material, with holes for attaching to outstretched wings. Such nets and winged scarabs were placed over mummified bodies in the Late Period, after about 700 BC, as amuletic covering for the body.
